body.p:
State of Kentucky
Casey County S SS

Affiants Sarah Jane Harrison & Nancy Tucker Jr state that they were at Nancy Tuckers in Casey County on the 30 day of November 1864 -- and that Mr Robert, Shively -- Mr John Brownfield -- Mr Thomas Capeheart rode up to the house of the Sd Nancy Tucker and enquired for and searched the house of sd Nancy Tucker for W. B. Tucker stating that if they could find him they would blow his ^damned^ brains out, & that they believe that if they had found him they would have killed him -- The above named men who made the above threat live in Taylor County Ky and not more than Eight miles from W. B. Tuckers place of residence -- And that said W. B. Tucker would be in danger of lossing his life by comeing in that region of Country and is absent from that cause for his personal safety --

Sarah J ^her X mark^ Harrison
Nancy ^her X mark^ Tucker Jr

Subscribed and sworn to before
me by Sarah J. Harrison and Nancy Tucker Jr this 7th day of March 1865.
T W Wash Exr c c

Affiant S. B. Harrison states that on the morning of the 30th November 1864 in one half hour after the men named in the affidavit of Mrs Harrison & Miss Tucker above had left Tucker came on the place near home and this affiant and Lee Harrison met him and informed him of the threats that had been made against his life -- and advised him to leave -- whereupon he leaped from his horse and took to the bushes -- and apon their advice he left the country and has not been back since --
Subscribed & sworn to before me this 7th day of March 1865

T W Wash Exr c c
T W W
Mar 7 1865

Nancy Tucker
Sarah J. Harrison
Affidavits
